author: Special Correspondent
text:
“Requirements of farmers ddressed”

The Agrofood (India) Chamber of Commerce and Industry has welcomed the announcement of the Union Finance Minister, Arun Jaitley, in the budget that foreign direct investment would be allowed in the marketing of food products produced and manufactured in India. The agrofood chamber president, S. Rethinavelu, said in a statement that the announcement addressed the requirements of farmers and food processing industry.

The chamber, the statement said, was opposed to the entry of FDI in food retail sector as it might lead to entry of foreign food products. However, the present proposal to allow FDI to market the food products produced and manufactured only in India would strengthen the ‘Make in India’ initiative. The move would enable small and medium food processing units to employ new technologies for production of quality and innovative value added products. The statement also haled the reduction in basic customs duty on refrigerated containers.
title: Agrofood chamber hails FDI in food sector
